intro: Biscutella laevigata var. alpestris, commonly known as the alpine biscuitroot, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants, and is characterized by its small, white flowers and linear leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils at high elevations. It is known for its ability to tolerate cold climates and is often found in meadows and slopes. Its botanical features make it an important species in alpine ecosystems and a subject of study in plant ecology.
